<h1><a id="user-content-description" class="anchor" href="#description" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Description</h1>

<p>A large retailer wants to explore the predictability of response to a
tabloid mailing.</p>

<p>\sk </p>

<p>If they mail a tabloid to a customer in their data-base, can they
predict whether or not the customer will respond by making a
purchase.</p>

<p>\sk </p>

<p>The dependent variable is 1 if they buy something, 0 if they do not.</p>

<p>\sk</p>

<p>They tried to come up with xâs based on past purchasing behavior.</p>

<p>\sk</p>

<p>The Predictive Analytics team builds a model for \bl the probability the customer responds \bk given \rd information about the customer\bk.</p>

<p>\sk</p>

<p>What information about a customer do they use?</p>

<ul>
<li><code>nTab</code>: number of past orders.</li>
<li><code>moCbook</code>: months since last order.</li>
<li><code>iRecMer1</code>: 1/months since last order in merchandise category 1.</li>
<li><code>llDol</code>: log of the dollar value of past purchases.</li>
</ul>

<p>The data for these variables is obtained from the companies
operational data base.</p>

<h1><a id="user-content-preprocessing" class="anchor" href="#preprocessing" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Preprocessing</h1>

<p>We download the data and preprocess it first</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>download.file(
    <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>https://github.com/ChicagoBoothML/MLClassData/raw/master/Tabloid/Tabloid_test.csv<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,
    <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Tabloid_test.csv<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)

download.file(
    <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>https://github.com/ChicagoBoothML/MLClassData/raw/master/Tabloid/Tabloid_train.csv<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,
    <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Tabloid_train.csv<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)


<span class="pl-v">td</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> read.csv(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Tabloid_train.csv<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-v">td_test</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> read.csv(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Tabloid_test.csv<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)

<span class="pl-smi">td</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">purchase</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.factor(<span class="pl-smi">td</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">purchase</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.factor(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>)</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<h1><a id="user-content-summary-statistics" class="anchor" href="#summary-statistics" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Summary statistics</h1>

hist(<span class="pl-smi">td</span>[<span class="pl-smi">td</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">0</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>nTab<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>], <span class="pl-v">breaks</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">40</span>, <span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>red<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,

hist(<span class="pl-smi">td</span>[<span class="pl-smi">td</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>nTab<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>], <span class="pl-v">breaks</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">40</span>, <span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>blue<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, 
     <span class="pl-v">main</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>responders<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">xlab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>nTab<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">xlim</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">85</span>))</pre></div>

plot(<span class="pl-smi">iRecMer1</span><span class="pl-k">~</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>,<span class="pl-smi">td</span>,<span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>red<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>blue<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
plot(<span class="pl-smi">llDol</span><span class="pl-k">~</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>,<span class="pl-smi">td</span>,<span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>red<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>blue<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))</pre></div>

<h1><a id="user-content-fit-models" class="anchor" href="#fit-models" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Fit models</h1>

<p>We fit</p>

<ul>
<li>logistic regression</li>
<li>random forest model</li>
<li>boosting</li>
</ul>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">tree</span>)
library(<span class="pl-smi">randomForest</span>)
library(<span class="pl-smi">gbm</span>)</pre></div>

<p>Create some helper function used for evaluation.</p>

<p>The following function is used to compute the deviance of a model</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> deviance loss function</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> y should be 0/1</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> phat are probabilities obtain by our algorithm </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> wht shrinks probs in phat towards .5 --- this helps avoid numerical problems don't use log(0)!</span>
<span class="pl-v">lossf</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>,<span class="pl-smi">phat</span>,<span class="pl-v">wht</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.0000001</span>) {
   <span class="pl-k">if</span>(is.factor(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>)) <span class="pl-v">y</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
   <span class="pl-v">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> (<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-smi">wht</span>)<span class="pl-k">*</span><span class="pl-smi">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-smi">wht</span><span class="pl-k">*</span>.<span class="pl-c1">5</span>
   <span class="pl-v">py</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> ifelse(<span class="pl-smi">y</span><span class="pl-k">==</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phat</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-smi">phat</span>)
   <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-k">*</span>sum(log(<span class="pl-smi">py</span>)))
}</pre></div>

<p>The following will get confucion matrix:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> deviance loss function</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> y should be 0/1</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> phat are probabilities obtain by our algorithm </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> thr is the cut off value - everything above thr is classified as 1</span>
<span class="pl-v">getConfusionMatrix</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>,<span class="pl-smi">phat</span>,<span class="pl-v">thr</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>) {
   <span class="pl-k">if</span>(is.factor(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>)) <span class="pl-v">y</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
   <span class="pl-v">yhat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> ifelse(<span class="pl-smi">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-smi">thr</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-c1">0</span>)
   <span class="pl-v">tb</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> table(<span class="pl-v">predictions</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">yhat</span>, 
                   <span class="pl-v">actual</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">y</span>)  
   rownames(<span class="pl-smi">tb</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>predict_0<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>predict_1<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
   <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">tb</span>)
}</pre></div>

<p>And finally, this function gives miss-classification rate:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> deviance loss function</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> y should be 0/1</span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> phat are probabilities obtain by our algorithm </span>
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> thr is the cut off value - everything above thr is classified as 1</span>
<span class="pl-v">lossMR</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>,<span class="pl-smi">phat</span>,<span class="pl-v">thr</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>) {
   <span class="pl-k">if</span>(is.factor(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>)) <span class="pl-v">y</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">y</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
   <span class="pl-v">yhat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> ifelse(<span class="pl-smi">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-smi">thr</span>, <span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-c1">0</span>)
   <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span> <span class="pl-k">-</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">yhat</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-smi">y</span>))
}</pre></div>

<p>We need a place to store results</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">phatL</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>() <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>store the test phat for the different methods here</span></pre></div>

<h2><a id="user-content-logistic-regression" class="anchor" href="#logistic-regression" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Logistic regression</h2>

<p>We fit a logistic regression model using all variables</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">lgfit</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> glm(<span class="pl-smi">purchase</span><span class="pl-k">~</span>., <span class="pl-smi">td</span>, <span class="pl-v">family</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">binomial</span>)
print(summary(<span class="pl-smi">lgfit</span>))</pre></div>

<p>Predictions are stored for later analysis</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> predict(<span class="pl-smi">lgfit</span>, <span class="pl-smi">td_test</span>, <span class="pl-v">type</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>response<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">logit</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-smi">phat</span>,<span class="pl-v">ncol</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) </pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-random-forest" class="anchor" href="#random-forest" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Random Forest</h2>

<p>We fit random forest models for a few different settings.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>set.seed(<span class="pl-c1">99</span>)

<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>#settings for randomForest</span>
<span class="pl-v">p</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>ncol(<span class="pl-smi">td</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
<span class="pl-v">mtryv</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-smi">p</span>, sqrt(<span class="pl-smi">p</span>))
<span class="pl-v">ntreev</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-c1">500</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1000</span>)
<span class="pl-v">setrf</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> expand.grid(<span class="pl-smi">mtryv</span>,<span class="pl-smi">ntreev</span>)  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> this contains all settings to try</span>
colnames(<span class="pl-smi">setrf</span>)<span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>mtry<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>ntree<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">rf</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-c1">0.0</span>,nrow(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span>),nrow(<span class="pl-smi">setrf</span>))  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> we will store results here</span>

<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>##fit rf</span>
<span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">setrf</span>)) {
   <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>fit and predict</span>
   <span class="pl-v">frf</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> randomForest(<span class="pl-smi">purchase</span><span class="pl-k">~</span>., <span class="pl-v">data</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">td</span>, 
                      <span class="pl-v">mtry</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">setrf</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>],
                      <span class="pl-v">ntree</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">setrf</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>],
                      <span class="pl-v">nodesize</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">10</span>)
   <span class="pl-v">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> predict(<span class="pl-smi">frf</span>, <span class="pl-v">newdata</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">td_test</span>, <span class="pl-v">type</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>prob<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)[,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>]
   <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">rf</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">phat</span>
}</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-boosting" class="anchor" href="#boosting" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Boosting</h2>

<p>We fit boosting models for a few different settings.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>#settings for boosting</span>
<span class="pl-v">idv</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">4</span>)
<span class="pl-v">ntv</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-c1">1000</span>,<span class="pl-c1">5000</span>)
<span class="pl-v">shv</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(.<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,.<span class="pl-c1">01</span>)
<span class="pl-v">setboost</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> expand.grid(<span class="pl-smi">idv</span>,<span class="pl-smi">ntv</span>,<span class="pl-smi">shv</span>)
colnames(<span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>tdepth<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>ntree<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>shrink<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">boost</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-c1">0.0</span>,nrow(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span>),nrow(<span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>))</pre></div>

<p>Remember to convert to numeric 0,1 values for boosting.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">tdB</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">td</span>; <span class="pl-smi">tdB</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">purchase</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">tdB</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>
<span class="pl-v">td_testB</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">td_test</span>; <span class="pl-smi">td_testB</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">purchase</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">td_testB</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>)<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span></pre></div>

<p>Fitting</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>)) {
   <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>#fit and predict</span>
   <span class="pl-v">fboost</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> gbm(<span class="pl-smi">purchase</span><span class="pl-k">~</span>., <span class="pl-v">data</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">tdB</span>, <span class="pl-v">distribution</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>bernoulli<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
              <span class="pl-v">n.trees</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>],
              <span class="pl-v">interaction.depth</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>],
              <span class="pl-v">shrinkage</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>])

   <span class="pl-v">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> predict(<span class="pl-smi">fboost</span>,
                  <span class="pl-v">newdata</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">td_testB</span>,
                  <span class="pl-v">n.trees</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>],
                  <span class="pl-v">type</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>response<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)

   <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">boost</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">phat</span>
}</pre></div>

<h1><a id="user-content-analysis-of-results" class="anchor" href="#analysis-of-results" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Analysis of results</h1>

<h2><a id="user-content-miss-classification-rate" class="anchor" href="#miss-classification-rate" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Miss-classification rate</h2>

<p>Let us first look at miss-classification rate.</p>

<p>For <strong>logistic regression</strong> we have:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>getConfusionMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]][,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>)
cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Missclassification rate = <span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, lossMR(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]][,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<p>For <strong>random forest</strong> we have:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">nrun</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> nrow(<span class="pl-smi">setrf</span>)
<span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">j</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nrun</span>) {
  print(<span class="pl-smi">setrf</span>[<span class="pl-smi">j</span>,])
  print(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Confusion Matrix:<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
  print(getConfusionMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">2</span>]][,<span class="pl-smi">j</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>))
  cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Missclassification rate = <span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, lossMR(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">2</span>]][,<span class="pl-smi">j</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)
}</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<p>For <strong>boosting</strong> we have:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">nrun</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> nrow(<span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>)
<span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">j</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nrun</span>) {
  print(<span class="pl-smi">setboost</span>[<span class="pl-smi">j</span>,])
  print(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Confusion Matrix:<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
  print(getConfusionMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">3</span>]][,<span class="pl-smi">j</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>))
  cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Missclassification rate = <span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, lossMR(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">3</span>]][,<span class="pl-smi">j</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.5</span>), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>)
}</pre></div>

<p>\sk\sk\sk</p>

<p>This is strange... There seems to be fit in the model.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>par(<span class="pl-v">mar</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-c1">3</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>), <span class="pl-v">mgp</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-c1">2</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0</span>)) 
<span class="pl-v">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> predict(<span class="pl-smi">lgfit</span>, <span class="pl-v">newdata</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">td</span>, <span class="pl-v">type</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>response<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
plot(<span class="pl-smi">phat</span><span class="pl-k">~</span><span class="pl-smi">td</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>red<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>blue<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>), 
     <span class="pl-v">xlab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>purchase<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>phat<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">ylim</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1.05</span>), <span class="pl-v">cex.text</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0.7</span>)</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-deviance" class="anchor" href="#deviance" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Deviance</h2>

<p>Plot test set loss --- deviance:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">lossL</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
<span class="pl-v">nmethod</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>)
<span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>) {
   <span class="pl-v">nrun</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> ncol(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])
   <span class="pl-v">lvec</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> rep(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-smi">nrun</span>)
   <span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">j</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nrun</span>) <span class="pl-smi">lvec</span>[<span class="pl-smi">j</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> lossf(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][,<span class="pl-smi">j</span>])
   <span class="pl-smi">lossL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]]<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">lvec</span>; names(<span class="pl-smi">lossL</span>)[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> names(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>)[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]
}
<span class="pl-v">lossv</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> unlist(<span class="pl-smi">lossL</span>)
plot(<span class="pl-smi">lossv</span>, <span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>loss on Test<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">type</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>n<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-v">nloss</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">0</span>
<span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>) {
   <span class="pl-v">ii</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">nloss</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>ncol(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])
   points(<span class="pl-smi">ii</span>,<span class="pl-smi">lossv</span>[<span class="pl-smi">ii</span>],<span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-v">pch</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">17</span>)
   <span class="pl-v">nloss</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">nloss</span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> ncol(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])
}
legend(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>topright<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">legend</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>names(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>),<span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>,<span class="pl-v">pch</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>rep(<span class="pl-c1">17</span>,<span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>))</pre></div>

<p>From each method class, we choose the one that has the lowest error on the validation set.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">nmethod</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>)
<span class="pl-v">phatBest</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-c1">0.0</span>,nrow(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span>),<span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>) <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span>pick off best from each method</span>
colnames(<span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> names(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>)
<span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>) {
   <span class="pl-v">nrun</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> ncol(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]])
   <span class="pl-v">lvec</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> rep(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-smi">nrun</span>)
   <span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">j</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nrun</span>) <span class="pl-smi">lvec</span>[<span class="pl-smi">j</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> lossf(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>,<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][,<span class="pl-smi">j</span>])
   <span class="pl-v">imin</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> which.min(<span class="pl-smi">lvec</span>)
   <span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][,<span class="pl-smi">imin</span>]
   <span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">i</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]][,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]
}</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<p>We can plot $\hat p$ for best models on the test set</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>pairs(<span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>)</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<p>The idea behind the tabloid example is that if we can predict who
will buy we can target those customers and send them the tabloid.</p>

<p>\sk</p>

<p>To get an idea of how well our model is working, we can imagine
choosing a customer from the data set to mail to first - did they
buy?</p>

<p>\sk</p>

<p>We can look at the y value to see if they bought.</p>

<p>\sk</p>

<p>Whom would you mail to first?</p>

<p>\sk</p>

<p>You could mail the first 40 people in your database.</p>

<p>\scriptsize</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">td</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">phat</span>
<span class="pl-smi">td</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">40</span>, c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>purchase<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>phat<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)]</pre></div>

<p>\normalsize\sk\sk
Out of the first 40, there is only one purchase.</p>

<p>\newpage</p>

<p>If you believe your model, you might mail to the household with
the largest $\hat p$ (estimated prob of buying) first. 
Then you would mail to the household with the second largest $\hat p$
and so on.</p>

<p>\scriptsize</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">td</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-v">phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">phat</span>
<span class="pl-v">sorted_phat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> order(<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-smi">phat</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">td</span>[<span class="pl-smi">sorted_phat</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">40</span>], c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>purchase<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>phat<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)]</pre></div>

<p>\normalsize
\sk\sk
You got 16 purchases out of the first 40 customers you targeted.
Using only 40/10000 = 0.004 of the data we got 16/258 = .062 of
the purchases!</p>

<p>\newpage</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-expected-value-of-a-classifier" class="anchor" href="#expected-value-of-a-classifier" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Expected value of a classifier</h2>

<p>Let us target everyone with $\hat p &gt; 0.02$</p>

<p>Our <strong>cost/benefit matrix</strong> looks like this</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">cost_benefit</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(c(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-k">-</span><span class="pl-c1">0.8</span>,<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">39.20</span>), <span class="pl-v">nrow</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>)
print(<span class="pl-smi">cost_benefit</span>)</pre></div>

<p>Expected values of targeting is below:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">confMat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> getConfusionMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>[,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.02</span>)
print(<span class="pl-smi">confMat</span>)
cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Expected value of targeting using logistic regression = <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, 
    sum(sum(<span class="pl-smi">confMat</span> <span class="pl-k">*</span> <span class="pl-smi">cost_benefit</span>)), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">confMat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> getConfusionMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>[,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.02</span>)
print(<span class="pl-smi">confMat</span>)
cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Expected value of targeting using random forests = <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, 
    sum(sum(<span class="pl-smi">confMat</span> <span class="pl-k">*</span> <span class="pl-smi">cost_benefit</span>)), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">confMat</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> getConfusionMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>, <span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>[,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>], <span class="pl-c1">0.02</span>)
print(<span class="pl-smi">confMat</span>)
cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Expected value of targeting using boosting = <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, 
    sum(sum(<span class="pl-smi">confMat</span> <span class="pl-k">*</span> <span class="pl-smi">cost_benefit</span>)), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)</pre></div>

<p>\newpage</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-roc-curves" class="anchor" href="#roc-curves" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>ROC curves</h2>

<p>Library for plotting various summary curves</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">ROCR</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>plot(c(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>),c(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>),<span class="pl-v">xlab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>FPR<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">ylab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>TPR<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">main</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>ROC curve<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">cex.lab</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-v">type</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>n<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>ncol(<span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>)) {
   <span class="pl-v">pred</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> prediction(<span class="pl-smi">phatBest</span>[,<span class="pl-smi">i</span>], <span class="pl-smi">td_test</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">purchase</span>)
   <span class="pl-v">perf</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> performance(<span class="pl-smi">pred</span>, <span class="pl-v">measure</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>tpr<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">x.measure</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>fpr<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
   lines(<span class="pl-smi">perf</span><span class="pl-k">@</span><span class="pl-smi">x.values</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]], <span class="pl-smi">perf</span><span class="pl-k">@</span><span class="pl-smi">y.values</span>[[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>]],<span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">i</span>)
}
abline(<span class="pl-c1">0</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-v">lty</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>)
legend(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>topleft<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">legend</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>names(<span class="pl-smi">phatL</span>),<span class="pl-v">col</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>,<span class="pl-v">lty</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>rep(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>,<span class="pl-smi">nmethod</span>))</pre></div>

<p>\newpage </p>
